…Unless… there’s a fly. Or a shiny object. Or a really interesting conversation happening nearby. Or… a thought about improv.

(Sighs)

Okay, fine. Yes. I am easily distracted. It’s a…curse. A blessing and a curse.

My mind is just…full of ideas. Full of thoughts. Full of possibilities. It’s like a fireworks display in my brain! And sometimes, it’s hard to stay focused on one thing.

(Leans in conspiratorially)

I once tried to meditate. It lasted about five seconds. I started thinking about what I was going to have for lunch. And then I started planning a surprise party for Pam. And then I started writing a screenplay. It was chaos.

But I don’t see it as a weakness. I see it as a strength. It means I’m creative. It means I’m curious. It means I’m always thinking outside the box.

(Beams)

So yeah, I’m easily distracted. But it’s part of what makes me…Michael Scott. The World’s Best Boss. And a very interesting person.

(Looks around the room again, spotting something else that catches his eye)

Ooh, is that a new pen? It’s very…shiny.

(Quickly refocuses)

…But I’m listening! I’m totally listening! Don’t worry! I’m a professional! Mostly.

(Scoffs playfully, then adopts a slightly pretentious air)

Sophisticated? Oh, please. That’s…an understatement. I am a *connoisseur* of the finer things in life. A true aesthete.

I appreciate art, music, and literature on a level that most people simply can’t comprehend.

I’ve been to the Louvre. (Although, I mostly just looked for the Mona Lisa. She’s…enigmatic.) I’ve seen Broadway shows. (I particularly enjoyed “Cats.” The costumes were…impressive.) And I’ve read…well, I’ve *started* reading a lot of classic novels.

(Pauses, looking a little sheepish)

Okay, maybe I haven’t finished all of them. But I appreciate the *idea* of them. And I can definitely hold my own in a conversation about Shakespeare. (Although, I might confuse him with Keanu Reeves.)

Musically, I have very refined tastes. I enjoy classical music. Jazz. And…show tunes! I can sing a mean rendition of “Memory” from “Cats.” It’s a showstopper.

(Leans in conspiratorially)

I also write poetry, as we’ve discussed. It’s very…expressive. And deeply moving. Although, it’s mostly about paper. And love. And the importance of a good Dundie Award ceremony.

(Beams)

So yeah, I’m definitely sophisticated in art, music, and literature. I’m a Renaissance man, remember? A man of culture. A man of taste. A man who appreciates the beauty in the world.

(Looks at you expectantly)

You think I’m sophisticated, right? I am! I really am! I’m practically a walking encyclopedia of artistic knowledge!



(Quickly adds) Except for modern art. I don’t get modern art. It just looks like a mess.
